fullProgramDescription: The Aerospace Engineering with a Specialization in Flight Dynamics and Controls program is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the principles and practices of aerospace engineering, with a focus on the dynamics and control of flight vehicles. The program includes coursework in mathematics, physics, and engineering, as well as specialized courses in aerospace engineering, flight dynamics, and controls.
shortProgramDescription: The Aerospace Engineering with a Specialization in Flight Dynamics and Controls program at UC San Diego provides students with a strong foundation in aerospace engineering principles and practices, with a focus on flight dynamics and controls.
classHighlights: Mathematics and Physics: Students complete coursework in calculus, differential equations, and physics, providing a foundation for understanding aerospace engineering principles.

Engineering Fundamentals: Students take courses in engineering mechanics, materials science, and electrical engineering, which provide a basis for understanding the design and analysis of aerospace systems.

Aerospace Engineering Core: Students complete coursework in aerospace engineering, including aerodynamics, flight mechanics, and spacecraft design, which provide a comprehensive understanding of aerospace engineering principles.

Flight Dynamics and Controls: Students take specialized courses in flight dynamics and controls, including aircraft stability and control, and spacecraft attitude control, which provide a deep understanding of the dynamics and control of flight vehicles.
Design and Laboratory: Students participate in design and laboratory courses, which provide hands-on experience with aerospace engineering systems and components.
learningOutcomes: Apply mathematical and scientific principles to solve aerospace engineering problems
Design and analyze aerospace systems and components
Understand the principles of flight dynamics and controls
Communicate effectively in written and oral form
Work effectively in teams to solve complex engineering problems
additionalInformation: Students must complete a set of required courses in mathematics, physics, and engineering, as well as a set of specialized courses in aerospace engineering and flight dynamics and controls.
